object_work_type: black-and-white prints (photographs) gelatin silver prints  photographic prints
physical_appearance: This is a pictorial of a half dressed fisherman who has his head wrapped with a piece of cloth. The print shows yellowing along its edges. In particular, a strip of browning/ blacking has occurred on its top right corner. Spotting can also be seen on the backing which the print is mounted on.
sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.
subject_terms_2: Photography, Artistic  Portrait photography  Fishers Fishing
techniques_name: gelatin silver process photographic printing techniques black-and-white photography
